Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Senior Data Analyst

Location: Scottsdale, AZ (On-site: Tuesday – Thursday)

Company: IntePros’ Premier Client

Company Overview

IntePros' premier client is a rapidly growing company specializing in real-time site intelligence and actionable reporting solutions for production builders and trades. Their innovative platform provides comprehensive visibility into site activities and powerful analytics to help businesses optimize operations, maximize resources, and enhance efficiency in the construction process.

Position Overview

The Senior Data Analyst will play a critical role in transforming complex business, customer, and technical data into actionable insights that drive decision-making for both internal stakeholders and external clients. This position requires a blend of technical expertise and business acumen to deliver advanced analytics and reporting across an integrated technology stack. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in data analysis, business intelligence tools, predictive analytics, and data modeling.

Key Responsibilities


Data Analysis & Insights:
Conduct deep-dive analyses on complex datasets using advanced analytical techniques to derive meaningful insights.
Analyze customer data (both qualitative and quantitative) to uncover trends and provide actionable recommendations for improvement.
Perform ad-hoc and in-depth analyses to support business decision-making.
Reporting & Visualization:
Design, build, and deliver reports, dashboards, and data visualizations to empower clients to unlock the full potential of the platform.
Develop and maintain a repository of standardized and customized reporting templates to ensure efficiency and consistency.
Communicate complex data insights effectively to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Collaboration & Stakeholder Management:
Partner with various departments (marketing, sales, product, operations) to understand business needs and align data projects with organizational goals.
Work with internal technical teams to address data gaps, improve data quality, and enhance reporting capabilities.
Machine Learning & Predictive Analytics:
Design, develop, optimize, and deploy machine learning algorithms, models, and applications.
Implement forecasting techniques to predict project timelines, focusing on reducing construction duration.
Utilize predictive analytics to support proactive decision-making and strategy development.
Technical Expertise:
Extract insights using data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau).
Develop solutions utilizing data lakes and cloud platforms.
Strong proficiency in Python and SQL for data extraction, manipulation, and analysis.
Key Requirements:


Experience:
Minimum of 4 years of experience in a data analytics role with a focus on solving complex business problems.
Proven track record in data analysis, statistical methods, and data visualization.
Experience with predictive analytics, machine learning, or forecasting methods is highly preferred.
Education:
Bachelor’s Degree in an analytical field (e.g., Computer Science, Business Management, Engineering, Information Systems, Mathematics, Statistics), or equivalent relevant experience.
Technical Skills:
Proficiency in Python, SQL, and Excel (including macros, pivot tables, and advanced formulas).
Strong experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau).
Knowledge of data lakes, cloud platforms, and Agile methodologies.
Soft Skills:
Strong business acumen with the ability to translate complex data into actionable business recommendations.
Excellent communication skills for presenting insights to stakeholders.
Self-starter with a proven ability to independently manage data analysis projects.
Preferred:
Experience in the home construction industry.
Work Environment:


This role requires on-site presence in Scottsdale, AZ three days a week (Tuesday – Thursday), with remote flexibility for the remainder of the week.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are looking for a Data & Reliability Analyst to join our team! If you are passionate about data-driven decision-making and improving system reliability, this role offers an excellent opportunity to collaborate with engineering and operations teams, analyze key data sets, and drive meaningful improvements.

Key Responsibilities:

Collaborate with engineering and operations stakeholders to leverage data for advanced analytics.
Analyze and operationalize data to produce reliability-focused health metrics.
Identify pain points and develop compelling narratives for improvement opportunities.
Implement and monitor reliability enhancement solutions using industry best practices.
Prepare executive-level reports, dashboards, and progress updates for senior leaders.

Preferred Qualifications:

Bachelor's Degree in a relevant field or equivalent experience.
2+ years of experience with Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint, and Word.
Proficiency with JIRA, Tableau, ELK stack, and Looker.
Familiarity with SQL and other query languages.

What Makes You a Great Fit:

Strong technical skills in data analysis (Excel, SQL, Tableau, ELK stack).
Excellent written and verbal communication, including experience creating executive-level presentations.
A curious mindset, problem-solving skills, and a drive for continuous learning.
Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment with a positive attitude.
Passion for improving system reliability and enhancing the customer experience.

If you are excited about this opportunity, we would love to hear from you! Please reply with your updated resume or apply directly.

Looking forward to your response!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
At ING we are looking for a Data Analyst




Your role and work environment:




We are looking for a talented and enthusiastic Data Analyst to join our Human Connection Strategy Team of Human Connection tribe.




If you are passionate about turning data into actionable insights and enjoy working directly with stakeholders to influence strategic decisions, this role is for you.




We are seeking someone who, in additions to being technically proficient, can translate complex data insights into clear business recommendations, communicate effectively with non-technical audiences, and contribute to driving key initiatives within the organization.




Your key responsibilities:




As a Data analyst you will:




Translate data into insights that inform strategic and operational decisions across the business.
Work closely with business stakeholders to understand their needs, co-create analytical approaches, and present results in a way that drives action.
Prepare and deliver high-impact presentations and data-driven narratives for senior leadership and cross-functional teams.
Bridge the gap between data and business, ensuring insights are understandable and actionable.
Collaborate with other teams in an International and agile environment, ensuring alignment and consistent communication.




What are we looking for?




Want to know if this job is made for you? These are some of the qualities that we value the most for this role. And if the shoe fits… don’t hesitate to apply!




For us, a Data analyst is someone who:




Knows about:




Bachelor’s degree in mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Business, Engineering, or similar.
3-4 years of experience in data analytics, business analytics, consulting, or related roles.
Solid knowledge of SQL and data visualization tools (e.g., power BI, Tableau) python or R is a plus but not essential.
Strong experience in data storytelling and creating business presentations.
Fluent English (spoken and written)
Understanding of business strategy and kpis to connect data insights with tangible business outcomes




Can:




Communicate complex data insights clearly and persuasively to non-technical stakeholders.
Proactively identify opportunities where data can add value and influence key decisions.




Loves to:




Collaborate in multidisciplinary teams, contributing to both technical and strategic conversations.
Present and defend your ideas with confidence and openness to feedback.




Defines himself/herself as a:




A team player with excellent interpersonal and communication skills.
Flexible, dynamic, and eager to work in fast-paced changing environments.




What do we offer?




The time you spend at work, the challenges you face or the lessons you get are very important, but… What about your personal life? At ING we want your work to fulfill you in every way, and that is why we take care of even the smallest details.




Check out what is waiting for you!




Be flexible my friend.

Our model is all about flexibility and accountability. Keeping both our customers and our colleagues’ needs in mind, you determine together which days you work at home and which you come to ING MAD to offer your best self. Do your thing.




Restaurant card.

So that thinking about what to have for lunch doesn’t take up your time or your cravings.




Our house will be your home.

In our offices you can find electric mobility solutions, doctor, hairdresser, gym, The Good Service (to help you with your errands) and much more!




Health insurance.

For you and all your family (spouse/partner and children).




Life insurance.

We help you protect what matters most to you.




Flexible remuneration.

In addition, you will enjoy our flexible remuneration model, through a more tax-advantaged way, you will be able to access other services such as nursery, transport card, training aids…




Free company shuttle.

It doesn't matter where you live. We have 6 routes (North, Central, South, A5, A42 and A6) to get you to our ING office in Madrid comfortably.




Banking benefits.

Special loans with more beneficial conditions.

Special mortgage conditions after 6 months working at the bank.

And you can benefit from our pension plan after 1 month with us!




More vitality and more belonging

360º care of the employee (physical, mental, social connection & purpose).

Physiotherapy service on site.

Clinics with professional, world-class athletes.

Gympass service.

Employee Networks: Rainbow Lions (LGBTQI+), Leonas & RIÑG.

International Remote work program.







Get to know Us




We are a team of more than 1700 people sharing one idea: doing our bit in helping our clients create a better future for themselves, by providing them with the tools they need to get where they want to go.




A fully online bank where technology, innovation, simplicity and transparency are the main ingredients, and the first one to work with agile methodologies.




And although we are based in Spain, we are lucky to work in an international bank with presence in more than 40 countries.




We are proud to have a diverse team, and we are committed to continue developing a culture of Diversity, Inclusion and Belonging to foster a culture of collaboration and innovation that represents all collectives in the society.




And even though we look orange on the outside, we are green on the inside. Our ambition in Sustainability is Empowering (y)our Sustainability journey. We are embarking on our path, for us, but we are also there for when our clients decide to embark on this journey.




Making things happen, helping others be successful, always being one step ahead—that’s our DNA. If you look at yourself in the mirror and your reflection matches our way of being and working…we are looking forward to meeting you!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Talan is an international advisory group on innovation and transformation through technology, with 5000 employees, and a turnover of 600M€.

We offer our customers a continuum of services to support you at each key stage of your organization's transformation, with 4 main activities:



CONSULTING in management and innovation : supporting business, managerial, cultural, and technological transformations.
DATA & TECHNOLOGY to implement major transformation projects.
CLOUD & APPLICATION SERVICES to build or integrate software solutions.
SERVICE CENTERS of EXCELLENCE to support the latter through technology, innovation, agility, sustainability of skills and cost optimization.



Talan accelerates it's clients' transformation through innovation and technology. By understanding their challenges, with our support, innovation, technology and data, we enable them to be more efficient and resilient.



We believe that only a human oriented-practice of technology will make the new digital age an era of progress for all. Together let's commit!




Job Description


For our client's project, one of the largest banks in Spain, we are looking for a Data Analyst for Reconciliation to join our consultancy team. The ideal candidate will have strong experience in data analysis, backend processing, and reporting tools within an Agile environment.



What would you be doing?








Extract, process, and analyze large datasets to support reconciliation processes.




Develop and maintain data pipelines using Python and PySpark.




Create insightful reports and dashboards with QlikSense or Power BI.




Collaborate with cross-functional teams in an Agile environment (Scrum/Kanban).




Ensure data accuracy and quality while optimizing processes.







Qualifications


What we are looking for?




Education: Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in a related field.




Experience: Minimum of 2 years as a Data Analyst in Delivery projects.




Technical Skills:




Strong proficiency in Python and PySpark for data processing.




Experience with QlikSense or Power BI for data visualization.




Familiarity with Agile methodologies (Scrum/Kanban).






Language: Intermediate English (B2 level).







Additional Information


What do we offer you?



Full-time contract
Smart Office Pack so that you can work comfortably from home.
Training and career development
Benefits and perks such as private medical insurance, life insurance, lunch and travel cards as part of the flexible remuneration package
Possibility to be part of a multicultural team and work on international projects
Hibrid position based in Málaga, Spain. Realocation is mandatory
Possibility to manage work-permits.



If you are passionate about development & tech, we want to meet you!

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
We’re always looking for the ones truly passionate about their work. If you are amongst them, you can rest assured there is a place for you in eMAG. We’ve grown very fast and are determined to keep doing so. What brought us here is our desire for continuous evolution and practical results.


More than 6000 colleagues are part of eMAG Teams. We strongly believe in people's development and therefore every year we invest more and more energy and resources to remain an organization that is constantly learning. We want to ensure that you’ll have the most talented colleagues and the proper environment to grow and achieve great results, to become what you desire on a personal and professional level. Join us, grow faster!


Data Analyst


What you'll have to do:


  • Build up strong relationships with suppliers to deliver effective and profitable plans.
  • Drive the conception, implementation, and development of the BI reporting landscape. This includes understanding stakeholder business needs, drafting specifications and monitoring/reviewing implementation with the BI team;
  • Act as a business partner and advisor for the commercial and financial department. Some recurrent needs can be solved with the help of the BI team, while other custom solutions should be provided by us. This means accessing and processing the data in a way that answers those needs;
  • Present results in a well-structured, efficient, and clear manner;
  • Derivate strategic recommendations based on comprehensive data analysis;
  • Standardize processes and reporting for enhanced efficiency;
  • Prepare ad-hoc reports and draw conclusions related to profitability, deliveries, product availability, active promotions, inventory levels, etc. based on stakeholder requests;
  • Offer support on data gathering, consolidation and verifications within the finance team.


What makes you a good fit:


  • 1-4 years of professional experience in data analysis;
  • Extensive knowledge of Excel and writing SQL queries;
  • Intermediate knowledge of Pandas (Python);
  • Intermediate knowledge of BI tools (Tableau);
  • Strong organizational skills, ability to work independently, with a focus on quality, detail, and accuracy;
  • Quick comprehension and ability to grasp new topics in detail;
  • Enthusiasm for developing, organizing, and analyzing large datasets;
  • Ability to describe complicated issues concisely and understandably;
  • High-quality standards for your own work;
  • Excellent spoken and written English skills.


What we've prepared for you:


  • Medical subscription: Medicover, MedLife or Regina Maria.
  • A flexible budget that you can invest in yourself as you wish: meal tickets, holiday tickets, cultural vouchers, private pension, foreign language classes, eMAG, Fashion Days, Therme & Genius, membership to different gyms or even professional development classes.
  • Different discounts from our partners: banking, mobile, dental medicine or wellness.
  • Access to the Bookster library and free credits on the Hilio psycho-emotional health platform.
  • An accelerated learning environment, with access to over 100.000 curated online resources and platforms, learning academies and development programs.
  • New headquarters, where sleek design, natural light, and versatile spaces create an energizing and comfortable environment for hybrid work.


Curious to find out more about the next step in your career? Apply now and if your experience is relevant for the role you wish, we will give you a call for more details!

Title: Data Analyst Intern
Description:
At BMW Group, we empower our customers to embark on an exciting journey with their BMW Group vehicles. Our dynamic Aftersales team continuously drives our business forward. So, if you are exploring real-life employment opportunities, you're sure to find an exciting challenge with us.




What awaits you?

In this role, you will be involved in:

Monitoring Parts Business - feedback to Management and Headquarters.
Monitoring all KPI’s and Dealers' performance via various reports.
Follow up on sales campaigns, special offers, discounts, special deals and other sales promotion programs - monitor the results and report to management.
Be responsible for providing all necessary reports in an accurate and efficient way.




What should you bring along?

Experience with Microsoft Office
High organizational skills
Fluency in English
Strong written and verbal communication skills




What do we offer you?

In addition to the motivating working environment in our dynamic teams, we offer:

Limited Contract
Continuous Training & Development opportunities.
A flexible working environment.
Well-being initiatives with various events.




Are you interested?

If the answer is yes, then do not miss the opportunity to apply and #shareyourpassion!✨




After the screening of all the CVs received, we will only contact the candidates who meet the requirements of the job to arrange an interview. All applications are considered strictly confidential.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Farfetch is a leading global marketplace for the luxury fashion industry. The Farfetch Marketplace connects customers in over 190 countries and territories with items from more than 50 countries and over 1,400 of the world’s best brands, boutiques, and department stores, delivering a truly unique shopping experience and access to the most extensive selection of luxury on a global marketplace.

OPERATIONS
We're passionate about operational excellence, acting with our customers and partners always in our heart. Covering the entire order journey, we create our online content, secure payments and fraud process compliance, ensure order fulfilment and delivery, while providing customer and partner care. In a nutshell, we love to create seamless and memorable luxury experiences for our customers all around the world.

PORTO
Our office is near Porto, in the north of Portugal, and is located in a vibrant business hub. It offers a dynamic and welcoming environment where our employees can connect and network with a large community of tech professionals.

THE ROLE
Reporting to the Analytics Manager, you’ll help solve complex data challenges and work with a wide range of tools to build accurate, scalable and innovative data solutions. With your analytical expertise and strong problem solving skills you’ll help the FintechOps department make better decisions with data!

What You'll Do


Tackle complex data problems with a variety of tools and implement innovative and scalable solutions
Leverage your proficiency in tools such as BigQuery, dbt and Python to efficiently extract and transform raw datasets into structured and usable formats
Build and maintain data models, reports and dashboards in BigQuery and Looker to provide stakeholders with relevant and timely information
Apply advanced statistical and analytical techniques to extract meaningful insights from large datasets
Proactively identify and resolve data-related issues, ensuring the reliability and integrity of analytical outputs
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and to implement data-driven solutions
Communicate complex findings in a clear and understandable manner to both technical and non-technical stakeholders





Who You Are


A bachelor's degree and a minimum of two years of relevant experience are required. Equivalent combinations of education and experience will be considered
Proficiency in SQL (SQL Server, BigQuery, or similar)
Experience using data visualisation tools (Looker, PowerBI, Tableau, or similar)
Knowledge of statistical programming languages like Python and/or R is a nice to have
Ability to work autonomously in solving complex technical problems
Detail-oriented with a focus on data accuracy and quality
Excellent communication skills with the ability to convey technical concepts to a non-technical audience
Advanced in English, both written and oral





Rewards & Benefits


Health insurance for the whole family, flexible working environment and well-being support and tools
Extra days off, sabbatical program and days for you to give back for the community
Training opportunities and free access to Udemy
Flexible benefits program





EQUAL OPPORTUNITIES STATEMENT


FARFETCH is committed to being an inclusive workplace where diversity in all its forms is celebrated. We make employment decisions without regard to race, religious creed, color, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, ancestry, marital status, medical condition as defined by state law, physical or mental disability, military service or veteran status, pregnancy, childbirth and related medical conditions, genetic information or any other classification protected by applicable federal, state or local laws or ordinances. If you require special accommodation, please let us know





SCAM DISCLAIMER


It has come to our attention that there may be fraudulent activities involving individuals or organizations falsely claiming to represent Farfetch in order to attract candidates to a SCAM. Please be aware that Farfetch does not conduct recruitment processes through messaging apps or any unofficial communication channels, other than our official careers website. Additionally, Farfetch will never ask candidates for any form of payment during the recruitment process

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst – Financial Services

Madrid, Spain - office based work.

Full-Time




About the Company:




My client are a leading financial services firm based in Madrid, dedicated to providing innovative financial solutions to a diverse range of clients. We are seeking a highly motivated and skilled Data Analyst to join our dynamic team. If you are passionate about working with data in the financial sector and want to be a key part of our growth, we want to hear from you!




Key Responsibilities:

Data Analysis: Collect, clean, and analyze large datasets related to financial markets, investment portfolios, trading, and economic indicators.
Financial Insights: Provide actionable insights by analyzing market trends, financial products, and client data to support decision-making processes.
Reporting: Develop and maintain automated dashboards and reports to present key financial metrics and trends to stakeholders.
Modeling & Forecasting: Support the development of predictive models, risk assessments, and forecasting tools to enhance investment strategies.
Collaboration: Work closely with teams across trading, risk management, and finance to ensure data-driven decision-making and business alignment.
Compliance & Accuracy: Ensure data integrity and comply with industry regulations, ensuring accuracy in all reporting and analysis.




Qualifications:




Education: A Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field such as Finance, Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science or Data Science from a top-tier university either globally or within Spain (e.g., Universidad de Barcelona, Universidad Autónoma de Madrid, IE University, or similar).

Experience:




A minimum of 2-3 years of experience working as a Data Analyst within the financial services industry (e.g., investment banks, asset management, trading, financial technology).
Solid understanding of financial data, including equity, bonds, derivatives, and market behavior.




Skills:

Proficiency in data analysis tools such as SQL, Excel, and Python or R.
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau).
Familiarity with financial data sources like Bloomberg, Reuters, or similar platforms.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to synthesize complex financial data into clear insights.
Fluent in English (both written and spoken); proficiency in Spanish is a plus.




What We Offer:

Competitive salary and benefits package.
Opportunities for career advancement and professional development.
A collaborative and dynamic work environment.
The chance to work with cutting-edge financial technologies.

Title: Data Analyst (Fashion Days Team)
HTML:
We’re always looking for the ones truly passionate about their work. If you are amongst them, you can rest assured there is a place for you in eMAG. We’ve grown very fast and are determined to keep doing so. What brought us here is our desire for continuous evolution and practical results.

More than 6000 colleagues are part of eMAG Teams . We strongly believe in people's development and therefore every year we invest more and more energy and resources to remain an organization that is constantly learning. We want to ensure that you’ll have the most talented colleagues and the proper environment to grow and achieve great results, to become what you desire on a personal and professional level. Join us, grow faster !

Data Analyst (Fashion Days Team)

Fashion Days through eMAG IT is looking for a Data Analyst to join their Fashion Days Platform Team. We need a person with background in Data Analysis to help us leverage data to enhance our customer experience and satisfaction. As a Data Analyst, you will work closely with stakeholders across the organization to understand their data needs and provide them with relevant insights and recommendations to support business decisions and goals.

What You’ll Have To Do

  • Gather, aggregate and analyze data from various sources, such as internal databases, Google Analytics and BigQuery to provide insights and support decision-making processes;
  • Work closely with your colleagues in improving the current tracking and develop new flows according to business needs;
  • Analyze and interpret complex data sets to identify patterns and insights in customer journey (such as traffic sources, conversion rates, purchase frequency);
  • Perform regularly data checks to ensure data accuracy, integrity and accessibility for analysis purposes;
  • Develop and maintain reports and dashboards using data visualization tools to communicate insights effectively to stakeholders;
  • Work together with product and marketing teams to provide data-driven recommendations for improving user experience;
  • Stay updated with industry best practices and emerging trends in e-commerce analytics, tracking and user behavior analysis.

What Makes You a Good Fit

  • University degree in Economics, Computer Science, or equivalent professional experience;
  • Have 2+ years’ experience as a Data Analyst or similar positions;
  • Have SQL experience;
  • Have strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to work with complex datasets;
  • Able to translate business problems into quantitative analyses and produce useful insights;
  • Have excellent communication skills to present findings and collaborate effectively with teams;
  • Detail-oriented and able to work independently;
  • Excellent English communication skills (spoken and written).

What makes you stand out: (optional)

  • Knowledge of Big Query and Google Analytics;
  • Familiarity with Python;
  • Experience with visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI or Looker Studio.

What We’ve Prepared For You

  • Medical subscription: Medicover, MedLife or Regina Maria.
  • A flexible budget that you can invest in yourself as you wish: meal tickets, holiday tickets, cultural vouchers, private pension, foreign language classes, eMAG, Fashion Days, Tazz, Therme & Genius, membership to different gyms or even professional development classes.
  • Different discounts from our partners: banking, mobile, dental medicine or wellness.
  • Access to the Bookster library and free credits on the Hilio psycho-emotional health platform.
  • An accelerated learning environment, with access to over 100.000 curated online resources and platforms, learning academies and development programs.
  • New headquarters, where sleek design, natural light, and versatile spaces create an energizing and comfortable environment for hybrid work.

Curious to find out more about the next step in your career? Apply now and if your experience is relevant for the role you wish, we will give you a call for more details!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

Who We Are

Cint is a pioneer in research technology (ResTech). Our customers use the Cint platform to post questions and get answers from real people to build business strategies, confidently publish research, accurately measure the impact of digital advertising, and more. The Cint platform is built on a programmatic marketplace, which is the world’s largest, with nearly 300 million respondents in over 150 countries who consent to sharing their opinions, motivations, and behaviours.

We are feeding the world’s curiosity!

Job Description

We are looking for a Data Analyst to support our Data Science & Analytics team in delivering high-quality insights through data exploration, analysis, and reporting. The ideal candidate is a self-starter, comfortable working with large datasets, automating processes, and supporting internal stakeholders with data-driven recommendations.

Responsibilities


Analyze large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and insights, ensuring quality and reliability of results.
Respond to ad hoc client-specific requests including performing analyses, data manipulation and producing summary results.
Generate reports and visualizations to effectively communicate findings to stakeholders to support decision making
Support campaign performance analysis and contribute to benchmark development and optimization.
Design scripts and tools to automate and streamline data extraction processes using Python, SQL, and APIs.
Develop interactive dashboards and reporting tools (such as Power BI, Tableau, Streamlit) to provide a clear overview of key metrics and insights.
Collaborate with stakeholders to enhance data collection processes.


Qualifications

Required:


Master’s degree or Bachelors in a quantitative field (e.g., Data Analytics, Statistics, Mathematics or a related discipline).
1-2 year(s) of experience in a data analysis role, preferably in market research, or advertising analytics.
Proficiency in Python (especially pandas and NumPy) for data manipulation.
Strong experience with MS Excel for analysis and reporting.
Experience working with large datasets and performing complex data transformations.
Strong analytical skills with a focus on data validation and accuracy.
Excellent communication skills to present findings and collaborate with internal teams and customers.
Self-starter with ability to work independently.


Additional Information

Nice to Have:


Experience in media measurement analytics.
Ability to write and optimize SQL queries.
Familiarity with Streamlit, Power BI, or Tableau for dashboarding.
Understanding of Databricks or similar cloud-based analytics platforms.


Our Values

Collaboration is our superpower


We uncover rich perspectives across the world
Success happens together
We deliver across borders.


Innovation is in our blood


We’re pioneers in our industry
Our curiosity is insatiable
We bring the best ideas to life.


We Do What We Say


We’re accountable for our work and actions
Excellence comes as standard
We’re open, honest and kind, always.


We are caring


We learn from each other’s experiences
Stop and listen; every opinion matters
We embrace diversity, equity and inclusion.


More About Cint

In June 2021, Cint acquired Berlin-based GapFish – the world’s largest ISO certified online panel community in the DACH region – and in January 2022, completed the acquisition of US-based Lucid – a programmatic research technology platform that provides access to first-party survey data in over 110 countries.

Cint Group AB (publ), listed on Nasdaq Stockholm, this growth has made Cint a strong global platform with teams across its many global offices, including Stockholm, London, New York, New Orleans, Singapore, Tokyo and Sydney. (www.cint.com)

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Back in 1966, in Marseilles, when the world was talking about Start Trek 🚀, Sodexo was serving its first customers, initiating our journey in the Quality-of-Life Services leaded by the bold Pierre Bellon.




Since then, we continued our adventure of offering everyday need solutions, improving the life of our users across the globe 🌎 supported by more than 400 thousand dedicated and brave colleagues, in 64 countries, that lead us to where we are today.




🇵🇹 Portugal is no exception and 5 years ago, our shared service center – Sodexo Business Services – SBS, was born! In here, you will have the chance to be part of several 📊🧾Financial teams like Record to Report, Order to Cash, Purchase to Pay, Financial Analysis, Master Data, among others, that support European markets, making sure the business continues to growth.







💥 Are you bold enough to join our crew, with your unique character and ideas, and make us even bigger?




💼 We are waiting for you! And so, your career!




In the meantime, check the opportunity below:




Senior Data Analyst




This position is responsible for gathering, analyzing, and interpreting complex data to help drive strategic decisions and optimize business processes. The role involves transforming raw data into actionable insights, developing reports and dashboards, and supporting the organization in identifying trends and opportunities for growth.




⚙ What will you do?

Primary tasks:

Create, restructure, and manage large datasets, files, and systems.
Develop clear and actionable visualizations through Power BI dashboards.
Filter, clean, and validate data, ensuring data accuracy and implementing performance indicators to identify and correct issues.
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex datasets with minimal guidance.
Present her/his findings to stakeholders in a clear and concise communication.




Secondary tasks:

Work closely with management to prioritize business and information needs.
Build stakeholder understanding of data usage and its impact on business decisions.
Apply business logic to guide analysis, synthesize findings, and deliver clear, actionable insights.
Follow standardized processes established by the Sodexo Data Factory.
Document data processing decisions and summarize data quality in technical memos.Support implementation of continuous improvement processes for stakeholders.
Continuously enhance technical skills and explore new technologies to stay current with industry advancements.




🤙 What you'll need to succeed?:

Bachelor’s degree in statistics, mathematics, economics, education, social sciences, or related fields required with two or more years of relevant work experience. Master’s degree preferred.
5/8 years of experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar , with a record of analyzing large datasets and delivering actionable insights.
Strong experience in using business intelligence tools, especially Power BI for data visualization and reporting.
Proficient in data manipulation and query languages, particularly SQL.
Strong knowledge of DBT, Databricks, or other data transformation & pipeline tools.
Proven ability to translate business needs into data models and analytics solutions.
Prior experience working in a data-driven environment and contributing to decision-making through analytics
Strong analytical skills with attention to detail and accuracy.
Strong problem-solving abilities with the capacity to approach complex data challenges methodically.
Excellent communication skills to explain data insights and their business impact to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Ability to work independently and manage multiple tasks while maintaining clear focus on business outcomes.
A proactive mindset with a passion for continuous learning and staying updated on new technologies and methodologies.







🎉 What we have to offer you?

Hybrid working model;
Flexible working hours;
Health & Life Insurance;
Attractive Meal allowance paid in Meal Card;
Additional Days off: extra vacation day, employee’s birthday, volunteering day;
More than 6000 free online courses;
Opportunity to grow professionally inside the Company;
Possibility to participate in multicultural projects;
Several internal activities aiming to promote our team´s wellbeing.




We are waiting for you!




Send us your CV to our email Recruitment.SBS.Portugal@sodexo.com with the title of the role on the subject and check all the opportunities on our career website (https://www.sodexo.com/en/contact-us/sbs-porto/porto-jobs)




Find out more about Sodexo: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XX7PoE9kazU




Sodexo is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment.

At Sodexo we believe in Privacy and your Privacy is very important to us that´s why your personal data will only be used for the purpose of managing our recruitment process, will be processed in accordance to the GDPR and treated confidentially. For further information about how we process your personal data please reach out to privacy.sbs@sodexo.com.

In here, you will have the chance to be part of several 📊🧾Financial teams like Record to Report, Order to Cash, Purchase to Pay, Financial Analysis, Master Data, among others, that support European markets, making sure the business continues to growth.



💥 Are you bold enough to join our crew, with your unique character and ideas, and make us even bigger?


💼 We are waiting for you! And so, your career!


In the meantime, check the opportunity below:


Senior Data Analyst


This position is responsible for gathering, analyzing, and interpreting complex data to help drive strategic decisions and optimize business processes. The role involves transforming raw data into actionable insights, developing reports and dashboards, and supporting the organization in identifying trends and opportunities for growth.


⚙ What will you do?

Primary tasks:

  • Create, restructure, and manage large datasets, files, and systems.
  • Develop clear and actionable visualizations through Power BI dashboards.
  • Filter, clean, and validate data, ensuring data accuracy and implementing performance indicators to identify and correct issues.
  • Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex datasets with minimal guidance.
  • Present her/his findings to stakeholders in a clear and concise communication.


Secondary tasks:

  • Work closely with management to prioritize business and information needs.
  • Build stakeholder understanding of data usage and its impact on business decisions.
  • Apply business logic to guide analysis, synthesize findings, and deliver clear, actionable insights.
  • Follow standardized processes established by the Sodexo Data Factory.
  • Document data processing decisions and summarize data quality in technical memos.Support implementation of continuous improvement processes for stakeholders.
  • Continuously enhance technical skills and explore new technologies to stay current with industry advancements.


🤙 What you'll need to succeed?:

  • Bachelor’s degree in statistics, mathematics, economics, education, social sciences, or related fields required with two or more years of relevant work experience. Master’s degree preferred.
  • 5/8 years of experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar , with a record of analyzing large datasets and delivering actionable insights.
  • Strong experience in using business intelligence tools, especially Power BI for data visualization and reporting.
  • Proficient in data manipulation and query languages, particularly SQL.
  • Strong knowledge of DBT, Databricks, or other data transformation & pipeline tools.
  • Proven ability to translate business needs into data models and analytics solutions.
  • Prior experience working in a data-driven environment and contributing to decision-making through analytics
  • Strong analytical skills with attention to detail and accuracy.
  • Strong problem-solving abilities with the capacity to approach complex data challenges methodically.
  • Excellent communication skills to explain data insights and their business impact to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
  • Ability to work independently and manage multiple tasks while maintaining clear focus on business outcomes.
  • A proactive mindset with a passion for continuous learning and staying updated on new technologies and methodologies.



🎉 What we have to offer you?

  • Hybrid working model;
  • Flexible working hours;
  • Health & Life Insurance;
  • Attractive Meal allowance paid in Meal Card;
  • Additional Days off: extra vacation day, employee’s birthday, volunteering day;
  • More than 6000 free online courses;
  • Opportunity to grow professionally inside the Company;
  • Possibility to participate in multicultural projects;
  • Several internal activities aiming to promote our team´s wellbeing.


We are waiting for you!


Send us your CV to our email Recruitment.SBS.Portugal@sodexo.com with the title of the role on the subject and check all the opportunities on our career website (https://www.sodexo.com/en/contact-us/sbs-porto/porto-jobs)


Find out more about Sodexo: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XX7PoE9kazU


Sodexo is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment.

At Sodexo we believe in Privacy and your Privacy is very important to us that´s why your personal data will only be used for the purpose of managing our recruitment process, will be processed in accordance to the GDPR and treated confidentially. For further information about how we process your personal data please reach out to privacy.sbs@sodexo.com.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Do you want to change the world? At Cabify, that’s what we’re doing. We aim to make cities better places to live by improving mobility for the people living in them, connecting riders to drivers at the touch of a button. Maybe one day cities will be places where nobody needs a private car. But we’ve still got a long way to go...fancy joining us?

About The Position

As a Data Analyst, you'll be part of an exceptional team of over 30 SQL and data visualization specialists. Our Data Analytics department is organized around 11 problem spaces that mirror the structure of the entire company, ensuring that every decision we make at Cabify is data-driven.

In your day-to-day role, you'll work in a multidisciplinary squad with other disciplines such as Product, Engineering, Growth, and Operations. We also follow agile methodologies within each analytics group and foster an environment of knowledge and resource sharing among the department.

If you're passionate about managing large volumes of data, you'll be delighted to know we leverage two different data warehouses, Google BigQuery and Amazon Redshift, to perform intensive analysis thus maximizing operational efficiency.

We take pride in working with one of the largest Tableau Server platforms in Europe, where we share not only powerful analysis and visualizations but also Self Service Data Sources, making data accessible to the entire company.

You Will

Work in technical data projects autonomously to enhance the company's analytics capabilities through functions such as:


Exploit large-scale data warehouses performing efficient SQL.
Define ETL models in our datawarehouse with Airflow.
Document and maintain your code and queries in Gitlab.
Create dashboards and reports using Tableau / PowerBI to communicate results and monitor KPIs regularly.
Execute exploratory analysis to shape future projects and provide action recommendations.
Present findings to squad team members to guide business and product decisions.
Work closely with engineers to define what data is needed for analysis, request creation of new app events, 3rd party integrations, collaborate in the data models design, granularity, and how they relate to existing models.
Help design new features alongside product managers and engineers, measuring their performance and testing their business impact.
Develop Data Sources to use across the organization, thus empowering business by exploring data in a trusted environment.


Our Ideal Candidate Has


Great alignment with our principles, we take this very seriously.
At least 1-2 years of working experience as a Data Analyst
Experienced in writing and understanding complex SQL and working with large data sets
Working knowledge of Tableau, Qlik, PowerBI, Looker, or any other data visualization tool
Graduate degree in Business Administration, Economics, Engineering, Statistics, or related fields
Fluency in English and Spanish


Bonus Points


A Master's degree in Business Analytics, Business Intelligence, or related
Product Analytics experience with Amplitude, Datadog, Mixpanel, or similar


What’s it like to work at Cabify?

We’re a Company Full Of Happy, Motivated People And We Never Want That To Change. Here Are Some More Reasons Why It Rocks To Be Part Of Our High-performance Team

⌚Hybrid Model (2 work-from-home days per week plus 6 weeks per year)

💶Excellent Salary conditions: L2 [30-40K€]

🏝️Recharge days

🌍Our office is located in Madrid.

⌚Flexible work environment & hours.

🙌Regular team events.

🚗Cabify staff free rides.

🚀Personal development programs based on our career paths.

🧘‍♀️ iFeel: Free access to the iFeel platform, so you can take care of your emotional well-being through therapy sessions.

📐Coursera: your own license in Coursera to take as many courses as you wish and continue developing your skills.

💳Flexible compensation plan: Restaurant tickets, transport tickets, healthcare and childcare

💻All the equipment you need (you only have to bring your talent).

🐱A pet room, so you don’t have to leave your furry friend at home

☕️And last but not least...free coffee and fruit!

Cabify is proud of being an equal-opportunity workplace. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees regardless of background, gender, religion, orientation, age, or ability.

Join us!
Show more

Title: Stanowisko ds. zarządzania obszarem BI i HD-specjalność inżynierii systemów Hurtowni Danych
Description:
Nazwa jednostki organizacyjnej


ZUS Oddział we Wrocławiu


Nazwa komórki organizacyjnej


Departament Statystyki i Prognoz Aktuarialnych


Miejsce pracy


ZUS Oddział we Wrocławiu


Adres miejsca pracy


ul. Pretficza 11, 50-930 Wrocław


Województwo


dolnośląskie


Nazwa stanowiska


Stanowisko ds. zarządzania obszarem BI i HD-specjalność inżynierii systemów Hurtowni Danych


Zadania


Zadania


zapewniać utrzymanie i rozwój architektury biznesowej i technicznej obszaru Hurtowni Danych
odpowiadać za proponowanie, budowanie i wdrażanie rozwiązań z zakresu technologii przetwarzania dużych zbiorów danych (Big Data), m.in. modelowania danych, projektowanie modelów ekstrakcji danych, projektowania i utrzymanie systemów magazynowania danych
odpowiadać za analizowanie wydajności sprzętu i oprogramowania w obszarze Hurtowni Danych
uczestniczyć w planowaniu inicjatyw i projektów mających na celu rozbudowę i optymalizację wykorzystywanych rozwiązań w obszarze Hurtowni Danych
współpracować przy projektowanie procesów ETL (Extract, Transform, Load), ELT (Extract, Load, Transform) w celu pozyskiwania, przetwarzania i ładowania danych z różnych źródeł do systemów klasy Hurtowni Danych
uczestniczyć w pracach projektowych, wdrożeniowych i testowych w obszarze Hurtowni Danych
wspierać użytkowników w ramach wdrożeń systemów i narzędzi w obszarze Hurtowni Danych
uczestniczyć w przygotowaniu planu rozwoju (roadmapy) dla środowiska Business Intelligence i Hurtowni Danych
proponować usprawnienia dla realizowanych procesów i zmiany w dokumentacji
Wymagania


Wymagania Niezbędne


wykształcenie wyższe
doświadczenie zawodowe minimum 1 rok (w pracy związanej z planowaniem, tworzeniem i rozwojem w obszarach Business Intelligence i\lub Hurtowni Danych)
staż pracy ogółem minimum 2 lata


Mile Widziane


wykształcenie wyższe (matematyka, informatyka, statystyka)
doświadczenie zawodowe minimum 2 lata (w pracy związanej z planowaniem, tworzeniem i rozwojem w obszarach Business Intelligence i\lub Hurtowni Danych)


Wymagania Dodatkowe


umiejętność obsługi programów MS Office
Znajomość języka SQL
orientacja na cel
orientacja na jakość
komunikacja
współpraca
elastyczność
nastawienie na rozwój
negocjowanie i wywieranie wpływu
podejmowanie decyzji
umiejętność rozwiązywania problemów
innowacyjność


Wymagane Dokumenty


CV
listu motywacyjnego
skan dokumentów potwierdzających wykształcenie
skan dokumentów potwierdzających wymagane doświadczenie zawodowe
skan świadectw pracy dokumentujących wymagany staż pracy lub zaświadczenie o zatrudnieniu zawierające okresy zatrudnienia, w przypadku pozostania w stosunku pracy


Dokumenty należy przesyłać poprzez formularz aplikacyjny 'Aplikuj', znajdujący się na dole oferty

Dodatkowe Informacje


proces rekrutacji obejmować będzie rozmowę kwalifikacyjną (przeprowadzoną w formie zdalnej przez komunikator internetowy - wywiad on-line) lub stacjonarnie
skontaktujemy się tylko z kandydatami spełniającymi wymagania formalne
oferty niekompletne tj. niezawierające skanu, któregokolwiek wymaganego dokumentu nie będą rozpatrywane
oferty przesłane po terminie nie będą rozpatrywane
miejscem świadczenia pracy będzie Centrala ZUS lub dowolny Oddział ZUS
możliwość pracy w trybie stacjonarnym, zdalnym lub hybrydowym
Termin, do którego należy składać dokumenty


12-02-2025


Oferujemy


Oferujemy


stabilne zatrudnienie na podstawie umowy o pracę
możliwość rozwoju zawodowego
bogaty pakiet świadczeń socjalnych
system premiowy


Zakład Ubezpieczeń Społecznych jest pracodawcą przyjaznym osobom z niepełnosprawnościami. Stwarza pracownikom optymalne środowisko pracy, uwzględniając ich potrzeby. Istnieje możliwość dostosowania stanowiska pracy i jego wyposażenia do indywidualnych potrzeb osób z niepełnosprawnościami

Wyposażenie Stanowiska Pracy


sprzęt komputerowy,
sprzęt biurowy.


Warunki Wykonywania Pracy


spełniają warunki określone wymogami bhp i ppoż.,
polegają na obsłudze komputera powyżej 4 godzin na dobę,
konieczność poruszania się po całym obiekcie,
konieczność wykonywania pracy poza biurem,
konieczność odbywania podróży służbowych,
budynek 3-piętrowy z windą oraz pomieszczeniami sanitarnymi dostosowanymi do potrzeb osób niepełnosprawnych,
stanowisko pracy zlokalizowane w pomieszczeniach biurowych na 3- piętrze,
miejsce pracy dostosowane do osób poruszających się przy pomocy wózka inwalidzkiego,
wejście do budynku jest zorganizowane z poziomu chodnika,
drzwi przy wejściu do budynku otwierają się automatycznie,
w bezpośrednim sąsiedztwie wejścia do budynku znajdują się miejsca parkingowe dla osób z niepełnosprawnościami

sprzęt komputerowy,

spełniają warunki określone wymogami bhp i ppoż.,

miejsce pracy dostosowane do osób poruszających się przy pomocy wózka inwalidzkiego,
wejście do budynku jest zorganizowane z poziomu chodnika,
drzwi przy wejściu do budynku otwierają się automatycznie,

Stanowisko ds. zarządzania obszarem BI i HD-specjalność inżynierii systemów Hurtowni Danych

  • Zadania

Zadania

  • zapewniać utrzymanie i rozwój architektury biznesowej i technicznej obszaru Hurtowni Danych
  • odpowiadać za proponowanie, budowanie i wdrażanie rozwiązań z zakresu technologii przetwarzania dużych zbiorów danych (Big Data), m.in. modelowania danych, projektowanie modelów ekstrakcji danych, projektowania i utrzymanie systemów magazynowania danych
  • odpowiadać za analizowanie wydajności sprzętu i oprogramowania w obszarze Hurtowni Danych
  • uczestniczyć w planowaniu inicjatyw i projektów mających na celu rozbudowę i optymalizację wykorzystywanych rozwiązań w obszarze Hurtowni Danych
  • współpracować przy projektowanie procesów ETL (Extract, Transform, Load), ELT (Extract, Load, Transform) w celu pozyskiwania, przetwarzania i ładowania danych z różnych źródeł do systemów klasy Hurtowni Danych
  • uczestniczyć w pracach projektowych, wdrożeniowych i testowych w obszarze Hurtowni Danych
  • wspierać użytkowników w ramach wdrożeń systemów i narzędzi w obszarze Hurtowni Danych
  • uczestniczyć w przygotowaniu planu rozwoju (roadmapy) dla środowiska Business Intelligence i Hurtowni Danych
  • proponować usprawnienia dla realizowanych procesów i zmiany w dokumentacji

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About The Team

Backing Uber's creativity with operational efficiency. This is the Team's mission statement. In essence, the Team helps Uber to scale and best serve its users by performing work around two main pillars i) Analytics & Automation - data science, data analysis, query & dashboard creation, automation of business process, ii) Process - design, execution & optimization of business processes. Located in Krakow, the Team is centralizing work for Uber Rides & Uber Eats, covering two mega-regions, i) United States & Canada, ii) Europe, Middle East, and Africa. This experience gained as Data Analyst may also, going forward, open doors to plenty of new opportunities across the world, via the Uber Mobility Program. We're offering a hybrid model of working (50% based out of our Krakow office, 50% work from home).

About The Role

After creating queries and dashboards, you will proceed to significant data analyses in order to provide insightful recommendations to Stakeholders, valuable inputs for strategic decisions. As Data Analyst, you will work together with other Team Members: Process Optimization Specialists and Automation Specialists. This is a great opportunity if you want to further develop your analytical skills, build sophisticated dashboards, use tools such as Data Studio, Google Sheets or Tableau and create actionable insights for large-scale operations, with concrete impacts.

What You'll Do


Analyze data, identify trends and build meaningful recommendations
Present your results in a concise manner to international Stakeholders
Design, lead & execute projects independently or in coordination with peers
Conduct root cause analyses, build dashboards, prepare data-driven proposals


What You'll Need


Good knowledge in SQL, Google Sheets
Analytical and data-driven approach for solving problems
Ability to work independently, on your own initiative
Motivation to learn all along the way and improve continuously
Excellent written and spoken Communication (in English)
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
About the Role:

We are looking for a data wizard to join our Data Analytics team as part of our Data & Advanced Analytics department.

As a data analyst you will interact with data warehouse developers, data engineers and other key stakeholders to maintain the data ecosystem up to date and we are counting on your curiosity and technical knowledge to extract actionable insights from terabytes of data.



Responsibilities:

  • Key role in creating and maintaining dashboards using Power BI that display key performance indicators which are used across the company;
  • Work closely with analysts from other departments on defining and implementing solutions for new reporting needs, offer support regarding data inquiries;
  • Leverage analytical applications to translate data into stories and explain the meaningful conclusions of the analysis in written verbal and visual form;
  • Answer to ad-hoc data requests.


Requirements:

  • 3+ years of relevant analytical experience in a Data Analyst/Reporting Analyst/Business Intelligence Developer position;
  • Previous experience using SQL to manipulate large volumes of data;
  • Previous experience working with data visualization tools (e.g. Power BI, Tableau or Qlik);
  • Ability to be flexible and work analytically in a problem-solving environment;
  • Ability to present data analysis results using storytelling capabilities;
  • Ability to work independently while prioritizing multiple projects and tasks.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Talan is an international advisory group on innovation and transformation through technology, with 5000 employees, and a turnover of 600M€.

We offer our customers a continuum of services to support you at each key stage of your organization's transformation, with 4 main activities:



CONSULTING in management and innovation : supporting business, managerial, cultural, and technological transformations.
DATA & TECHNOLOGY to implement major transformation projects.
CLOUD & APPLICATION SERVICES to build or integrate software solutions.
SERVICE CENTERS of EXCELLENCE to support the latter through technology, innovation, agility, sustainability of skills and cost optimization.



Talan accelerates it's clients' transformation through innovation and technology. By understanding their challenges, with our support, innovation, technology and data, we enable them to be more efficient and resilient.



We believe that only a human oriented-practice of technology will make the new digital age an era of progress for all. Together let's commit!




Job Description


For our client's project, one of the largest banks in Spain, we are looking for a Data Analyst for Reconciliation to join our consultancy team. The ideal candidate will have strong experience in data analysis, backend processing, and reporting tools within an Agile environment.



What would you be doing?








Extract, process, and analyze large datasets to support reconciliation processes.




Develop and maintain data pipelines using Python and PySpark.




Create insightful reports and dashboards with QlikSense or Power BI.




Collaborate with cross-functional teams in an Agile environment (Scrum/Kanban).




Ensure data accuracy and quality while optimizing processes.







Qualifications


What we are looking for?




Education: Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in a related field.




Experience: Minimum of 2 years as a Data Analyst in Delivery projects.




Technical Skills:




Strong proficiency in Python and PySpark for data processing.




Experience with QlikSense or Power BI for data visualization.




Familiarity with Agile methodologies (Scrum/Kanban).






Language: Intermediate English (B2 level).







Additional Information


What do we offer you?



Full-time contract
Smart Office Pack so that you can work comfortably from home.
Training and career development
Benefits and perks such as private medical insurance, life insurance, lunch and travel cards as part of the flexible remuneration package
Possibility to be part of a multicultural team and work on international projects
Hibrid position based in Málaga, Spain. Realocation is mandatory
Possibility to manage work-permits.



If you are passionate about development & tech, we want to meet you!





Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
At Arkadium our purpose is to have fun while creating fun - and that's exactly what we've been doing for 20 years. We're the creators behind the world's most-played games. From the Solitaire that came on your Windows machine, to hundreds of other games you've come to know and love - you can find our games on Arkadium.com, iOS, Android, and lots of other big sites worldwide.

As a proud Evergreen business our values of Fierce Drive, Positive Energy and Living Full Lives are the driving force behind how we run and the choices we make.

We're privately held (aka stable and reasonable about growth), founder-led (aka passionate about our craft) and we consistently rank as a "Best Place to Work" (aka not your typical games company).

Interested in becoming an Arkadian? We'd love to hear from you!

Overview

As a Data Analyst, you will play a crucial role in connecting business strategy with data-driven insights. You will work closely with cross-functional teams, including Product, Marketing, and Operations, to analyze key metrics, interpret trends, and develop actionable recommendations that drive business growth. Beyond technical skills, we seek a candidate who can bridge the gap between data and decision-making, ensuring that insights translate into impactful business strategies.

What You'll Do:


Conduct ad-hoc analyses using statistical methods to answer business-critical questions.
Interpret and translate data findings into actionable recommendations for stakeholders.
Define and own data processes, from event tracking and data collection to building structured datasets and dashboards.
Develop and maintain data visualizations and reports to communicate insights clearly and effectively.
Collaborate with Product, Marketing, and other business units to identify data needs and align analytics efforts with company objectives.
Ensure data integrity and accuracy through proactive auditing, validation, and monitoring.
Work with engineering and data teams to enhance data pipelines, implement tracking strategies, and optimize data models.



Requirements

What You Bring:


Bachelor's degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related field (or equivalent experience).
3+ years of experience in a data analyst or similar role.
Strong analytical mindset with expertise in statistical methods and hypothesis testing.
Proficiency in SQL for querying and data manipulation.
Experience with Python and/or R for data analysis, modeling, and automation.
Ability to communicate complex data concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Strong business acumen with a problem-solving mindset to drive data-backed decisions.



Preferred Qualifications:


Experience in web analytics and understanding of website performance metrics.
Familiarity with cloud-based infrastructure (e.g., Azure).
Experience with BI tools (Power BI, Tableau) for data visualization.
Hands-on experience with Databricks or other big data processing platforms.
Knowledge of A/B testing methodologies and marketing analytics.



Benefits

Why Join Arkadium?


High-Impact Role - Work at the intersection of strategy, execution, and technology, influencing the company's trajectory.
Fast-Paced, High-Growth Environment - No two days are the same. You'll be challenged, stretched, and given autonomy to make an impact.
Leadership & Growth Opportunity - Manage a small but high-impact team and take ownership of critical company initiatives.
Collaborative, Agile Culture - We move fast, work hard, and have fun while doing it.
Shape the Future - Be part of a company that is redefining browser gaming and driving innovation in the space.



Benefits


Competitive compensation with structured performance and career development check-ins.
Meaningful health insurance.
Meal allowance.
Personal development budget to fuel your passions and desire to learn (Arkadians are taking classes in not only Excel and leadership, but also interior design and even swimming!)
Additional budget for conferences you are interested in.
Professional Coaching Budget .
Time off from Christmas Eve through New Year's Day so we can all enjoy the holidays.
Summer Fridays: 4 Fridays off throughout the Summer to have more fun in the sun.
A unique culture of transparency, true teamwork and fun.


This role is open to candidates based in Portugal. Business hours are 9-18 WEST (UTC+1). For candidates based in the Lisbon area, this role will transition to a hybrid model, requiring in-person presence. For candidates located outside the Lisbon area in Portugal, a different cadence of in-person presence may apply, depending on proximity.
Show more

dashboard related to IFCC and customer journey, data insights on campaigns

deliver data insights on campaigns

Title: Analista de datos
Place: Las Rozas de Madrid, Community of Madrid, Spain
Description:
¿Te apasiona el análisis de datos y la generación de insights estratégicos? En Ocasionplus buscamos un Analista de Datos para reforzar nuestro equipo.




Funciones principales:

- Creación y automatización de informes comerciales y operativos.




- Extracción, limpieza y análisis de datos para optimizar la toma de decisiones.




- Desarrollo de dashboards interactivos en Power BI (o similares) para mejorar la visualización de datos.




- Creación y optimización de modelos de datos y consultas SQL.




- Colaboración con equipos internos para mejorar los flujos de información y la eficiencia operativa.




Requisitos para destacar en el puesto:




- Formación en ADE o Finanzas, con un plus si tienes un posgrado en Big Data, Data Science.




- Experiencia mínima de 2 años en funciones similares.




- Manejo avanzado de herramientas de análisis y reporting: Power BI, SQL, Python, R.




- Habilidades para trabajar con grandes volúmenes de datos y generar informes estratégicos.




¿Eres una persona analítica, organizada y con ganas de asumir nuevos retos? Si te interesa formar parte de un equipo puntero en Ocasionplus Te esperamos.

Title: Data Analyst Intern (H/F/N)
Description:
Company Description

Believe is one of the world’s leading digital music companies. Believe’s mission is to develop local artists and labels in the digital ecosystem by providing them the solutions they need to grow their audience at each stage of their career and development.

Its 2,020 employees in more than 50 countries aim to support local artists and labels with a unique digital expertise, respect, fairness and transparency.

To support our fast-growing presence on all continents, we are constantly looking for new Believers to join us and make a stronger and more positive impact on the music industry!

Believe is listed on compartment A of the regulated market of Euronext Paris (Ticker: BLV, ISIN: FR0014003FE9).

Ready to #setthetone with Believe?

Job Description

ROLE’S EXPECTATIONS

As a Data Analyst Intern in the Product Team, you will contribute to the success and growth of many artists and labels. Your insights will directly shape the strategies that help artists grow their fanbase and reach new heights in their careers. You'll dive into cutting-edge projects, from developing advanced data models to uncovering viral trends that shape the music industry by analyzing impact of Believe’s partners, including Spotify, YouTube, TikTok, and others...

Your Key Responsibilities Will Include

Creation and improvement of Power BI Dashboards:


design and develop dashboards to track the performance and accuracy of Tiktok viral trends detection data models,
follow the adoption of Believe products by artist, producers and internal teams,


Conducting Ad Hoc Analyses to support artists making the best decisions to develop their audience at every stage of their career, Turn your insights into actionable data models that will be integrated into our products, helping artists make informed decisions every day.

Qualifications


Demonstrated interest for the music industry,
studying in last year of a master’s degree from an Engineering or Business school with a specialization in data. Looking for an end-of-studies internship,
previous internship or student experience working with data or analytic topics,
proficient with SQL and visualization tools, Python a plus. Anyway, you are curious and fast learner, you love watching online tutorial until you become expert in a new coding language,
fluent in English, spoken and written. Comfortable working day to day in English.


Additional Information

Our interview process is designed to be as transparent and supportive as possible, giving you a chance to showcase your skills and learn more about our team. The process will consist of one HR fit interview, one case study to test analytic skills and two interviews with the team.

Ready to make your mark on the future of music? Apply now and start your journey with Believe!

Set the tone with us

Working at Believe means having individual and collective impact in a fast-growing company!

At all stages of their careers, Believers are an important part of what we are doing: shaping the future of the music industry.

We need teams that truly reflect the diversity of our clients: our international presence is an inspiring and enriching work environment for each one of us, with daily opportunities to connect with our colleagues all over the world.

We have two hearts at Believe - our People and our Artists.

We believe in THE POWER OF OUR PEOPLE, who grow every day to develop their potential… We aim to provide our Believers with the best environment to thrive.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Position: Data Analyst

Qualification: Beng/B.Tech/MSc. in Computer Science or similar

Location: Dundalk, Co. Louth, Ireland




About XOCEAN

XOCEAN is an ocean data company – we collect data for clients ranging from mapping the seabed to monitoring the environment. However, we do this differently, instead of using conventional crewed survey ships, we have developed a marine robotic system known as an Uncrewed Surface Vessel (USV).




Overview

We are seeking a Data Analyst to support our growing data operations, working with large datasets from autonomous surface vessels (USVs). You will be responsible for analyzing operational, survey, and performance data while ensuring data integrity and automation of reporting systems.




Main Duties & Responsibilities

Analyze and process large datasets from offshore surveys, including navigation and geospatial data.
Develop and maintain Power BI dashboards to visualize operational efficiency, survey progress, and utilization metrics.
Create data models and reports to support decision-making across projects, using SQL and Python.
Ensure data quality and consistency by implementing data validation and governance frameworks.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including survey engineers and operations teams, to provide actionable insights.
Automate data workflows using Power Query, Python, and SQL to optimize reporting processes.
Support predictive analytics and machine learning initiatives to improve survey forecasting and vessel performance.




Requirements: Essential Skills / Attributes and Experience

2-5 years of experience as a Data Analyst or similar role.
Strong proficiency in Power BI, SQL,Grafana ( or similar tools) and Python for data processing and automation.
Experience working with large datasets from marine, geospatial, or operational data sources.
Knowledge of data governance, quality control, and reporting best practices.
Familiarity with cloud-based data storage (AWS/Azure) and automation tools like Power Automate is a plus.
Ability to work independently and in a fast-paced, project-driven environment.
Experience in agile project management is a plus.




Apply

Applicants must demonstrate how they meet the essential criteria. Desirable criteria may be used for further shortlisting.
We thank all candidates for their interest, however due to very high volumes, only those who are selected for further consideration, will be contacted directly.
To be eligible for this position you must have a valid working visa / permit to work in Ireland.
Please apply online and follow the instructions, or submit your CV to careers@xocean.com.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
ABOUT BRUNEL




Founded in 1975, Brunel has developed into an international group with 12,000 employees and a turnover of €1.4 billion. We deliver Project and Consulting Solutions, Workforce Solutions and Global Mobility Solutions that transform global projects in Renewables, Conventional Energy, Mining, Life Sciences, Future Mobility, Industrials & Technology and many other sectors.




Brunel is listed on Euronext Amsterdam NV and is included in the Amsterdam Small Cap Index (AScX). The organization has grown into a renowned global brand with more than 120+ offices in over 40 countries on 6 continents.




ABOUT THE TEAM




You’ll be joining Brunel’s Market & Business Intelligence (M&BI) team, part of our Global Sales Enablement function. We’re a lean, high-impact team enabling faster, smarter, and more strategic decisions across the business.




At M&BI, we combine market research, consultancy, and data analytics to support Brunel’s strategic priorities and growth execution. Our mission is to turn data into decision intelligence, driving value through insight, efficiency, and innovation.




Reporting to Manager of M&BI, this role helps expand our impact by advancing strategic awareness and analytical capabilities.




ABOUT THE ROLE




We’re seeking a hands-on, execution-focused data analyst to accelerate our transition from descriptive reporting to diagnostic and predictive analytics. You'll build models, design dashboards, and run experiments that prioritize growth initiatives and inform high-impact decisions.




This role is ideal for someone who thrives in execution, bring strong technical expertise, and is curious to understand the "why" behind the data.




WHAT YOU'LL DO




Client - Focused & Client-Facing Reporting and Analytics (40%)




Build intuitive Power BI dashboards and reports that are:

Client-focused: based on client-related data (e.g. customer behaviour, chum, BD targeting)
Client-facing; visually polished, presentation- ready, and aligned with required communication standards




Trend Analytics & Modelling (40%)




Perform root cause analysis, forecasting, and segmentation to uncover performance drivers
Conduct segmentation and clustering analysis to identify behavioural or performance patters across regions, clients ortalent groups




Analytics Process & Tool Scaling (20%)




Build scalable (self-service) tools and templates for recurring insights needs
Support the evolution of our internal data ecosystem by contributing to data structure, quality, and integration efforts
Document processes and methodologies to ensure reproducibility and knowledge sharing




Evolving area (future-focused)




This evolving area includes hypothesis-driven analysis, pressure-testing assumptions, and scenario modelling. You'll partner closely with the M&BI Manager to explore emerging questions and translate them into data-backed insights that support strategic decisions




WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR




The ideal candidate will have academic-level intellectual and professional capabilities, with a minimum of 4 years of experience in a complex (international) organization. Key qualifications include:




Power BI Mastery: Advanced DAX, data modelling for experimentation, visualization design and performance tuning.
Data handling: Proficient in SQL and comfortable with Python
Analytical techniques: Solid foundation in segmentation, root cause analysis, and forecasting
Experience with Databricks or other cloud platforms(e.g. Azure, AWS)
Familiarity with data governance
Active listening & business communication
Growth mindset: Curious, adaptable, and open to learning advanced modelling and strategic analytics techniques
Model development: Exposure to or interest in building scenario models and statistical testing
Bachelor’s or Master’s in Data Science, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, or a related field




INTERVIEW PROCESS




Two interviews and an online assessment




WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU




Competitive base salary
Hybrid (3 days in the office) & flexible working
Coaching and mentoring through weekly check-ins
Friendly, collaborative & supportive team environment
Laptop and smart phone with Microsoft powered IT tools
Benefits; including pension scheme, group health insurance, 26 paid vacation days with the option to buy upto 40 vacation days per year, travel allowance scheme, bicycle lease plan, gym discount
Through the Brunel Academy - Brunel's learning & development programme - you have every opportunity to continue to develop yourself, both professionally and personally
Show more
