Title: Quantitative Analyst
Description:
The Portfolio Group plays a pivotal role in the SS business, managing assets and funds totaling $20 billion in Assets Under Management (AUM). This team collaborates closely with leadership and deal teams to navigate analytical, strategic, and operational issues, ultimately optimizing fund performance and driving profitability.




Key Responsibilities:

- Develop and maintain projection models for GSS funds, enhancing forecasting precision and investment strategies.

- Support fund financing endeavors, including structuring models and conducting fund-level impact analyses to ensure robust financial health.

- Provide analytical assistance during fundraising initiatives and investor reporting to uphold transparency and stakeholder engagement for the GSS business.

- Oversee the cash positions of GSS funds, managing the funding pipeline and coordinating capital calls/distributions effectively.

- Assist in the management of US SS portfolio reporting, tracking key performance indicators (KPIs), value creation initiatives, and potential risk factors.

- Maintain a centralized system for tracking fund information, encompassing asset allocations, historical returns, fund financings, and ongoing value optimization efforts.

- Contribute analytical insights during evaluations of new fund investment products and strategies.




Qualifications:

- Strong academic background with a BA/BS from a respected institution; a concentration in Finance or a quantitative field such as Mathematics, Statistics, or Economics is preferred. CFA designation is a plus.

- 1 to 4 years of relevant experience in data or risk analytics, portfolio management, or strategic finance; familiarity with asset management and various investment products (like private equity and credit) is advantageous.

- Proficient in Excel, with hands-on experience in managing datasets and applying financial models/scenario analytics; experience with VBA and Power BI is beneficial.

- Competence in PowerPoint, pivotal for effective communication of analytical insights to diverse stakeholders.

- Strong interpersonal skills, facilitating management of relationships across different organizational levels.

- Excellent verbal and written communication skills, coupled with meticulous attention to detail.

- Ability to handle multiple tasks in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.

- A successful candidate must display a positive, proactive attitude and possess critical thinking skills to tackle complex business queries.

Title: Epicor Data Analyst
Description:
Industrial Data Engineer

Position Overview

We are seeking an experienced Industrial Data Engineer to join our team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for designing and implementing data solutions to enhance our operational efficiency and drive strategic decision-making. You will work closely with various departments to collect, analyze, and visualize industrial data to improve business processes and performance.

Key Responsibilities


Design and develop data pipelines to integrate industrial data from multiple sources including Epicor systems.
Conduct data analysis to identify trends and insights that can drive business improvement initiatives.
Create and maintain data visualization tools and dashboards to present key metrics to stakeholders.
Support business intelligence efforts by providing accurate reporting and insights based on data analysis.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand their data needs and provide solutions that enhance decision-making capabilities.
Participate in the development of KPIs to measure performance and support process improvement initiatives.


Qualifications


Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Engineering, or a related field.
Proven experience with Epicor systems and data integration.
Strong SQL skills for data manipulation and querying.
Experience in data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or similar.
Familiarity with data analysis techniques and reporting methodologies.
Knowledge of business intelligence concepts and practices.
Proficient in Excel for data analysis and reporting.
Understanding of financial analysis and data mining techniques.
Experience in KPI development and process improvement strategies.

Title: Records, Systems & Data Analyst
Description:
Position Summary

Cambrian College’s Office of the Registrar Department requires a Records, System and Data Analyst on a Full-Time basis.

Note: Internal candidates, as defined by the Full-Time Support Staff Collective Agreement, will be given first consideration.

Duties and Responsibilities

Reporting to the Associate Registrar, the Records, Systems and Data Analyst will be responsible for:


Overseeing data integrity as it relates to the collection, organization, and submissions of the college’s operational and institutional reporting requirements.
Contributing to the development of data systems, tables and reports.
Providing guidance to other staff regarding data standards and record integrity.
Leading the effort to build reports and data extracts from the Student Information System (SIS)
Assisting in ensuring that the integration between SIS modules are operational and optimized in an effort to ensure that data outputs are compliant with college policy, Ministry directives, and operational requirements
Undertaking special assignments related to the enhancement or modification of the underlying data systems, and reporting tables.
Leading the work of identifying, designing, validating, debugging and maintaining data tables, queries, and views that facilitate automated data processing and reporting tasks


Qualifications

Required:


Minimum of a three-year postsecondary diploma, or equivalent in a discipline emphasizing computer programming, data analysis and/or statistics, or a diploma or degree in a related field (A copy of educational documents must be submitted with application *** education completed outside of Canada, applicants are required to submit a WES or ICAS with their application)
Must have a minimum of five years practical experience working with data in enterprise applications
Must have proficient critical analysis skills
Excellent knowledge of computer software such as relational databases with statistical/reporting applications
Must also have experience with relational databases, as well as troubleshoot, debug and write complex formulas/codes
Highly motivated professional with excellent interpersonal, communication, and time-management skills.
Collaborative professional who can work independently and within a team environment.


Additional Assets/Preferred


Experience working with Cambrian’s Student Information System (Banner), SSMS/SQL and PowerBI
Experience working within a postsecondary environment.


Required Information

To be considered, candidates must provide the following as an attachment:


Educational documents
WES/ICAS Equivalence if degrees/diplomas are from a Non-Canadian University

Cambrian College offers the following benefits to full-time Support Staff employees:

Vacation Days


15 Vacation Days (after one year of continuous service)


Mandatory Benefits


Basic Life Insurance
Accidental Death and Dismemberment
Short Term Disability
Long Term Disability
Extended Health Care
Dental Care
Vision Care
Hearing Care
Pension Plan


Optional Health Care Benefits

College Employees Can Purchase The Following Benefit Plans


Supplementary Life Insurance
Employee Optional Life Insurance
Dependent Life Insurance
Spousal Optional Life Insurance
Critical Illness


CAAT Pension Plan

Our employee benefit plan package includes a defined benefit pension to help you create a secure future. The CAAT Penion Plan provides you with a predictable lifetime retirement income, survivor benefits, early retirement options, and more without the stress of making investment decisions.

CAAT makes it easy for you to build stable, secure retirement income while you work.

Explore a career choice with a pension at http://www.caatpension.ca/dbprime-pensions-for-talent

Employee Perks


Education and Technology Loan Plan
Tuition Subsidy Program
Higher Education Funding
Technology Loan Plan
Family Tuition Bursary Program
Discounted Access to Fitness Facility/Fitness Classes


We also offer have a variety of employee discounts available at retailers

Title: FM Research Graduate Internship 2025 Climate Risk and Resilience - Tornado Loss Database
Description:
FM is a leading property insurer of the world's largest businesses, providing more than one-third of FORTUNE 1000-size companies with engineering-based risk management and property insurance solutions. FM helps clients maintain continuity in their business operations by drawing upon state-of-the-art loss-prevention engineering and research; risk management skills and support services; tailored risk transfer capabilities; and superior financial strength. To do so, we rely on a dynamic, culturally diverse group of employees, working in more than 100 countries, in a variety of challenging roles.

Exciting and interesting technical challenges await when you join a world-class research team dedicated to reducing the impact of natural hazards. FM helps clients maintain continuity in their business operations by drawing upon state-of-the-art engineering and research.

The Climate Risk & Resilience Team At FM Is Seeking a Creative, Self-motivated Individual For An Internship In Norwood, MA. The Intern Will Work Under The Supervision Of Senior Staff And Will Have The Opportunity To Tackle Real-world Science And Engineering Challenges In The Insurance Industry. The Project Involves


Cleaning past tornado loss data
Linking these losses to known tornadoes and tornado outbreak events
Collecting available engineering information related to the losses
Creating a searchable GIS database


The internship is planned to last 3 to 6 months. By the end of the internship, the intern will gain experience in


Tornado research
Insurance losses
Wind engineering


We Are Looking For Undergraduate Students In Good Academic Standing Who Wish To Expand Their Research Experience Beyond Academia. Ideal Candidates Will Have


Attention to detail
Strong analytical skills
GIS skills (e.g., ArcGIS, QGIS, GDAL)
Experience with programming languages such as MATLAB, R, Python, and FORTRAN
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Comfort with writing shell scripts and using APIs to automate workflows
Familiarity with both Microsoft Windows and Linux environments


This is an in-office role based in Norwood, MA. Temporary relocation support provided for selected qualified candidate.

FM is an Equal Opportunity Employer and is committed to attracting, developing, and retaining a diverse workforce.

Title: BI Report Writer
Description:
Our client is seeking a BI Report Writer to play a key role in building out their Business Intelligence (BI) applications over the next year. This position requires a Qlik Sense expert who can develop insightful reports, optimize data processes, and improve business decision-making through advanced analytics.




Key Responsibilities:

Develop, maintain, and optimize Qlik Sense dashboards and reports.
Work closely with business stakeholders to gather requirements and translate them into effective BI solutions.
Create and manage datasets to ensure data integrity and usability.
Identify opportunities to streamline business processes using data insights.
Extract, transform, and load (ETL) data from multiple sources for reporting purposes.
Provide data-driven recommendations to improve operational efficiency.




Required Skills & Experience:

Qlik Sense expertise (development, data modeling, and visualization).
Strong ability to put together datasets for analysis and reporting.
Experience pulling out business requirements and translating them into BI solutions.
Knowledge of SQL and other relevant data tools for data extraction and transformation.
Background in business process improvement and analytics-driven decision-making.




Why Join?

Opportunity to build and shape BI applications from the ground up.
Work with a dynamic team focused on data-driven improvements.




This is a HYBRID opportunity (3 days onsite)

Title: Senior Business Intelligence Analyst, Commercial Operations
Description:
Job Description Summary

For over forty years, HarbourVest has been home to a committed team of professionals with an entrepreneurial spirit and a desire to deliver impactful solutions to our clients and investing partners. As our global firm grows, we continue to add individuals who seek a collaborative, open-door culture that values diversity and innovative thinking.

In our collegial environment that’s marked by low turnover and high energy, you’ll be inspired to grow and thrive. Here, you will be encouraged to build on your strengths and acquire new skills and experiences.

We are committed to fostering an environment of inclusion that promotes mutual respect among all employees. Understanding and valuing these differences optimizes the potential of both the individual and the firm.

HarbourVest is an equal opportunity employer.

This position will be a hybrid work arrangement, which translates to 2-3 days minimum per week in the office.

Are you ready to join a world-class team and take your career to the next level? HarbourVest Advisers L.P. is seeking a Business Intelligence Sr. Analyst, Commercial Operations, based in Boston, MA, USA. In this role, you will develop fundraising reporting and dashboards and deliver analytics and insight to support Investor Relations and Commercial Operations, making a significant impact on our ambitious goals.

The ideal candidate is someone who is:


Exceptionally skilled in developing standardized fundraising dashboards in Salesforce and PowerBI.
Proven to have experience with query tools such as SQL.
Meticulous with the ability to automate critical metric tracking.
Adept at partnering with business leaders to deliver insightful analysis.
Ambitious and motivated to successfully implement new initiatives.
Capable of storytelling with data


What you will do:


Develop and maintain fundraising reporting and dashboards in Salesforce, PowerBI and other tools.
Streamline the process of tracking critical metrics.
Support business leaders with actionable insights.
Analyze data to identify and target potential LPs.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure seamless integration of BI tools.
And other responsibilities as required.


What you bring:


Experience with Salesforce.com reporting.
Experience with BI tools or visualization tools such as PowerBI and Tableau
Proficiency in query languages like SQL.
Strong analytical skills with a proven track record of data-driven decision-making.
Outstanding attention to detail and accuracy.
Ability to work collaboratively in a team-oriented environment.
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.
Ability to manage multiple projects and meet deadlines.
Positive attitude and a willingness to learn and adapt.
Proficiency in automating processes and improving operational efficiency.
Experience in supporting go-to-market strategies with data insights.


Education Preferred:


Bachelor of Science (B.S) or equivalent experience
Master of Science (M.S) or equivalent experience


Experience:


5-8 Years experience in a capacity preferred
